title: JIRA :Hero of Project Management Tools
overall_text: its a great experience using JIRA and I would recommend it to use .
pros_text: its workflow management - easy transition from one state to another .access management - restricting users from updating or configuring boards to avoid unintended confusions .bug tracking and user story creations - made my easy to track and progress in right direction .
cons_text: with my current usage of JIRA - nothing I dislike about JIRA - it does everything that I am asked to do .it

title: JIRA - A Must have ITSM
overall_text: Very useful, one-stop solution with related to ITSM, Ticketing and change management.
pros_text: Highly customizable dashboard is a huge turn on. You can see almost everything that is going on may be whether it is a project or an issue
cons_text: When an issue go unaddressed for a long period of time, I suggest that there should be any way to automatically escalate or generate a reminder.

title: Ottimo strumento per la gestione di progetti
overall_text: Positiva ma migliorabile. Si può sempre migliorare
pros_text: Riesci ad avere degli scambi real time sui requisiti direttamente con i team di progetto. Utile come strumento.
cons_text: Le etichette/icone che distinguono le varie funzionalità non sono accessibili. Migliorerei il sistema di monitoraggio dei progetti, lo renderei più grafico. Darei la possibilità al sistema di notifica(mail) di vedere direttamene in chiaro il messaggio senza andare necessariamente sul tool

title: Jira Service Desk Review
overall_text: It is an excellent ticketing system, easy to use, and track incidents.
pros_text: I used this software when I worked on atechnical support help desk. I liked that the dashboard functionality and the ability to customize your view. There is a variety of widgets that are supported thatassist with efficiency.
cons_text: Our company worked with a separate company that also utilized this product. We created separate incidents in both systems if their assistance was needed. We noted each ticket with the relationship to the other's Jira system. While working in two systems was a con in regards to ease of use, this is not a fault of the software itself as there are obvious security issues in linking two companies together.

title: Undoubtedly a way to speed up the reporting of issues
overall_text: Overall, I've had a great time working with Jira. The ability to send us email updates when our request was successfully submitted and when there is an update to our request for new equipment is its most notable feature. Undoubtedly a way to speed up the reporting of issues. Also, the interface with Outlook is excellent.
pros_text: We use Jira to record or create tickets so we can report any issues to our IT management or ask for new equipment. By enabling us to submit tickets without going to our IT room, it saves us time, and we have had nothing but great experiences with it.
cons_text: Nothing that comes to me right now. Newcomers may find it frightening at first, but ultimately you grow used to it.

title: Great defect management tool
overall_text: Jira excels in defect management with its robust issue tracking, collaborative workflows, advanced search capabilities, extensive integration options, and customizable features, making it a powerful tool for efficiently tracking, resolving, and analyzing defects throughout the software development lifecycle.
pros_text: Jira provides a comprehensive and customizable platform for tracking defects where t eams can create, categorize, and prioritize issues with ease. Jira also provides robust reporting and analytics capabilities, which allow teams to have a great overview and metrics related to defects.
cons_text: Absence of some functionalities needed for test plan management: - to copy test cycles through the projects (usefull for regression testing)- to delete more test cycles from the test plan at the same time

title: Works flawless, with different possibilities, butthe search feature is on low quality lately.
overall_text: Overall, it is easy to use, and it is easy issue management tool for new features.
pros_text: I like, that it is easy to use, create a tickets, create additional fiels, labels, different priorities. It is possible to clone the issues, and edit them as fast as possible. Everything can be organized as you like. Also there is some automation tools as well.
cons_text: Lately i don't like the search function, because it is not always finding what i want, lately it is hard to find some specific issues.Previously it was working much more better. Not sure what was changed, but usually it is not finding the issues what is want. better to use some JQuerry.

title: Do all - do nothing
overall_text: Do you want a tool that does 1000 tasks but all of those tasks are 10% of what you need? GET THIS TOOL.Do you want a tool that has a million different customizations, yet none are what you want and everything is wrongly done? Get it !Sure it's cheap but with all the time you loose, not worth it.BTW, that 24/7 support, yeah, no, does not exist.
pros_text: Well here's a tool that does everything, SD, incidents, KB, alerts, yes, it does a bit or everything.
cons_text: It's awfull at doing things good. The new projects are barely compatible with new solutions, incidents and request are not configured correctly and can hardly be put in the same ticketing catalog. No advanced roadmaps (premium feature) in next gen projects. Automations are bad, tickets custom fields are sometimes not uderstood by the automation.

title: The best tool for Helpdesk which works seamlessly with Jira
overall_text: My team enjoys this tool a lot and we surely feel this is the most suited tool for the workflow we have. Highly recommend for helpdesk in IT
pros_text: Works so well with a support email ID to collect client helpdesk issues, and even link them to development (IT project) tickets
cons_text: Perhaps the dashboards can be easier and more insightful, for checking workload, number of issues managed per staff member etc

title: A Great App With Some Annoying Flaws
overall_text: Overall, Jira Service Desk provides a well rounded package for anyone looking to build a customer portal for helpdesk-type teams. It's an excellent choice if your company is already using Jira Software or Jira Business because the use workflow and editing workflow are very familiar and are one in the same for many things (e.g. Workflows & Screens)
pros_text: - Adds helpful features that Jira Software doesn't support- Clean customer portal that allows for easy(ish) ticket creation- Integrates with Confluence to provide helpful articles to customers- Customizable time tracking SLAs with support for custom calenders and start/pause/stop automation
cons_text: - The editing workflow is confusing and spread out- Lacks some common features that Jira Software had included for years (e.g removing email signatures from email-submitted tickets and comments)- Requires expensive add on to group multiple projects into one queue

title: Efficient and User-Friendly: A Review of JIRA Service Management
overall_text: JIRA Service Management is a widely used and well-regarded tool for service management and IT service desk operations. Many organizations find it to be an effective solution for managing incidents, requests, and support tickets, as well as tracking performance and progress. The customizable workflows and integration capabilities make it a versatile tool that can be adapted to meet the unique needs of different teams and organizations. However, the steep learning curve and limited customization options can be challenges for some users, and the setup process for some advanced features can be complicated. Overall, JIRA Service Management is a powerful tool that can deliver significant benefits to organizations that are looking to improve their service management processes.
pros_text: User-friendly interface for easy navigationCustomizable workflows to match the specific needs of a team or organizationStrong integration capabilities with other tools and systemsRobust reporting and analytics features for tracking performance and progressEfficient management of incidents, requests, and other support tickets
cons_text: The steep learning curve for users who are not familiar with JIRALimited customization options for the visual appearance of the interfaceThe complicated setup process for some advanced featuresIt can be slow to load when managing large amounts of dataPrice may be a barrier for small teams or businesses with limited budgets.

title: Visibility made easy :-)
overall_text: Handling of issuesVisibility of issuesService Desk reportingChange Request management and identifying the priorities in developments
pros_text: Level of functionality available and the level of detail is fantastic and easily configured. I managed to completely configure on my own with the use of the articles in the kb and minimal support from Atlassian.
cons_text: Difficult to completely personalize for my company completely as i am on cloud version. As an example it is not possible to have email sender not have atlassian in the email address or to make the look and feel 100% as i want it to be.Can also get a little overwhelming with the amount of add-ons to get the functionality you want for the price you want.

title: Best Management, Strong Monitoring
overall_text: Pros:The interface is user friendly. I can follow projects and processes quickly and easily. The findings opened for our outsourcing solution partners are great to view and report. It is clear who does what in the team and the status of the processes can be examined by everyone.
pros_text: Cons:I am very pleased with the features and functions I have encountered and used so far. There isn't a feature I don't like.

title: Cannot Manage Our Own Users
overall_text: JIRA customer support has been extremely unhelpful. Several tickets and requests have been issued (from several customers) in their customer portal with no response or solutions offered.
pros_text: I loved this software when we first implemented. We were able to mass upload our users, use custom user IDs, set their passwords, and link their email address through a simple file upload. We were also able to change their email addresses, and edit their names as needed.
cons_text: Over time, JIRA has made changes to the service that have led us to terminate our service. We are no longer able to edit anything but our users full name. We cannot change their email addresses to meet business needs, nor can we assign them a user ID - instead having to incorporate their ID into their name in order for us to find them in the system the service desk was designed for.

title: JIRA - Wonderful Task Management Tool
overall_text: Pros:First of all it has very interactive user friendly interface such that a developer can easily track down their efforts. We can prioritize the critical work first such that it get noticed to all and resolve first. For consistent and efficient completion of task, JIRA Service Management automates the workflow. Dashboard of a user gives a simple picture of what needs to be done or what is remaining.
pros_text: Cons:There nothing to dislike about JIRA Service Management tool. It is powerful tool for tracking the workflow in organizations.

title: Very Organized and Easy to User
overall_text: Over experience is very good , once setup it very easy to use and track all issues.
pros_text: It is very easy to use even for a new person. Very easy to track tickets and Overall Project status. Easy to get notification andticket assignment.
cons_text: When total number for ticket to be tracked is very high it feels little slow to respond. and also for non technical team it can be little tricky to setup initially.

title: A Necessary Tool for IT/Web Project Management
overall_text: I love this platform for project management and I strongly recommend it to all project managers, web managers, especially if you are working with vendors/teams outside of your organization. I've used JIRA for years and it's been one of the best platforms in my experience.
pros_text: It's easy to use and to flag bugs/enhancements to our development team. It's also easy to see where items are in the process of being solves or fixed, and it allows usthe flexibility to project manage our production pushes easily. It also allows us to easily collaborate with our dev partners, which we can't always do with other tools such as Teams, when we work with outside vendors.
cons_text: Sometimes the email notifications can get overwhelming, but I'm sure there's a setting that I can disable there.

title: One of the best project management software to have
overall_text: Overall, I would highly recommend Jira to any business or organization looking for a powerful and flexible project management software. Whether you're a small team or a large enterprise, Jira offers the features and functionality you need to manage your projects effectively and efficiently.
pros_text: It helps us track our tasks very efficiently, using tools and features provided by Jira Software. Like Jira Boards, Time Tracking\Work-logs, Reports, Email notifications, Filters and Dashboards are few which we are using most frequently.
cons_text: It has lots of customization options, which makes it bit complex specially during initial setup.

title: We have been using the Jira service desk for a couple of years - easy to get setup and started with
overall_text: The Jira Support Desk provides relatively straightforward integration with other Atlassian tools such as Bitbucket, Confluence and Tempo - we are ably to scope our support effort, track the resources expended and provide timely insight.
pros_text: The best part of the package is the ease of implementation, particularly the hosted subscription - no worries about hardware, security or backups!
cons_text: For the subscription implementation, there are occasionally changes made by the vendor for maintenance or security reasons without clear advance notification or a complete understanding of the impacts. As with any SaaS solution, vendor changes can be disruptive - even sometimes deprecating used features.

title: JIRA Service Management
overall_text: Pros:Jira est un meilleur logiciel de gestion de projet informatique très simple et compréhensible. Ces nombreuses fonctionnalités m'aident de façon simple à faire un bon management des grands projets de mon équipe en de petites idées. Aussi, avec son tableau de bord, nous arrivons à suivre l'évolution de tout notre activité en une place.
pros_text: Cons:Je n'ai pas de grandes inquiétudes par rapport à cette plateforme. Ma seule suggestion est que si vous pouvez baisser un peu les prix des tarifs, bien qu'il soit raisonnable, ça fera plus de joie à nous utilisateurs
cons_text: Switched From:AnyDeskandZendesk Suite

title: We use Jira for nearly all of our operational work
overall_text: We've been using Jira for about 5 years now and we're still happy with the way it works. We've never had any real issues with it.
pros_text: Their ticketing system is very expansive and customizable. They have a lot of features and integration possibilities as well.
cons_text: To set everything up to your liking there can be a bit of a learning curve. But once you know how everything works it's smooth sailing.

title: Ideal for issue tracking
overall_text: Pros:The high configurability and flexibility allow it to satisfy practically all use cases.The possibility of integrating it with an SCM saves time and allows you to rationalize commits.
pros_text: Cons:We would like the possibility of being able to develop configurations and apply them to various projects, as well as not being able to use all the features that are not needed.

title: Gestión profesional de proyectos
overall_text: En general la experiencia con Jira es buena, una vez que consigues configurarlo para que se adapte a tus necesidades y gracias a todas las opciones de visualización puedes tener mucha información muy útil para gestionar de forma óptima los proyectos.
pros_text: Jira te permite poder gestionar todas las tareas e incidencias de un proyecto, así como visualizar todo el flujo por el que pasa cualquier tarea hasta que es realizada y así poder tener un seguimiento global del proyecto. Tiene muchas opciones de personalización de la interfaz para poder visualizar cualquier tipo de métrica.
cons_text: La curva de aprendizaje es alta, ya que la herramienta cuenta con numerosas funcionalidades y el usuario que nunca la ha usado necesita un tiempo para familiarizarse.

title: Best for ticket tracking
overall_text: I like the integration of all the functions. The platform also has kanban boards so you can see all the tickets and the status they are on and it works great to show on daily standup meetings.
pros_text: I started using Jira when I moved into the software area and I like that is very user friendly and easy to use. You can start a ticket and include all the required information then have it approved. It has a flexible workflow and everyone can see every update on the ticket. I also like that it has analytics and charts to see the average time for different tickets and track your performance.
cons_text: The app version can be improved, I prefer working on the web platform. Has limited size uploads.

title: IT Service Management correctly embedded into Jira
overall_text: Pros:Jira Service Management implements ITIL-based functions that work very well and are easy to implement for a company of any size.
pros_text: Cons:The learning curve for users used to working with Jira Software is important to keep in mind. Jira Service Management has some particular functionalities that are different from regular Jira Software projects.

title: Jira is excellent tool to manage IT projects and utilize the resources
overall_text: I usually used it for medium complex projects with 8-12 number of users, I can say that jira increased my productivity.
pros_text: List of features I most liked about jira - Best project management with less efforts- Tasks are divided into tickets with description, assignee, reporter, priority of task, type of ticket like bug ticket, enhancement ticket etc. Also I can check the status of ticket like it's in progress, icebox or ready for code review etc so everything seems well organized.- I set milestones for long term projects.- With help of git I can create git branch from ticket itself
cons_text: It's hard to manage tasks when you you have lengthy project and number of tickets & number of users are high

title: Jira: La mejor manera de administrar y optimizar proyectos en TI.
overall_text: En general mi experiencia con Jira Service Management ha sido muy positiva, ya que me ha permitido avanzar a traves de los proyectos en que he participado de manera agil y ordenada, entregando incrementos de valor.
pros_text: Lo que mas gusta es toda la versatilidad de herramientas que posee y su facilidad de uso.
cons_text: Creo que seria bueno una versión de escritorio con igual de herramientas.

title: A short summary
overall_text: Pros:Although it's not the friendliest app, it has a plus because it has many apps you can integrate it with, and that helps quite a bit.
pros_text: Cons:One of the primary minuses is the app's interface, it's too outdated and quite hard to learn, it doesn't have the best logic, and it takes a while to get used to it, on top of that, it has some bugs, which you don't expect to find in such big apps, and it has some limitations, which can't be customised, like you can only add one user to the ASSIGN column.

title: Jira Service Desk is great for internal OR external teams.
overall_text: Overall, I would highly recommend Jira Service desk for two use cases: (1) when teams are working with outside customers; (2) when teams are working internally, but with users that are averse to diving into Atlassian's ecosystem.
pros_text: - Submitting a ticket is done through a form with a great UI.- Setting up submission forms is relatively easy and highly customizable- Ticket management can be customized, ensuring producers only see relevant information- As a producer, you'll have the option to share information internally or externally with the customer- SLAs are built into each request type- As with all things Jira, the reporting is fairly robust
cons_text: - One of the biggest downsides of Service Desk is that it does not yet support a kanban board. To that end, ticket management is done through a queue system.- Some essential automation is limited within the JQL - automation that is consistent in a Jira software project.

title: práticoe intuitivo
overall_text: excelente.utilizo várias vezes ao dia, para diversos projetos.delegação, encerramento e monitoramento super fácil
pros_text: Utilizo para monitorar meus projetos e delegar tarefas para os demais setores.gosto da facilidade de uso e da forma de organização das minhas rotinas.
cons_text: não vejo contras, já estou habituada a ferramenta. já faz parte do meu dia a dia

title: Best Ticket Tracking Tool
overall_text: We use Jira in our organization for tracking Issues, Incidents, Knowledge Base (Confluence), track inventory & risks. All in all there's nothing Jira can't do the integrations are just endless and I feel they would never be enough.
pros_text: Tons of features that will cater to all types of teams/organizations.The UI is intuitive and easy to learn.Gives all types insights on progress of tickets.
cons_text: Literally no cons, maybe I need to explore it more but I already feel like I've explored a lot. Some new integrations would really help.

title: Outil de ticketing et gestion de projet
overall_text: Pros:Outil programmable à souhait pour réaliser un outil de ticketing ou de gestion de projet par exemple. Convient pour de la méthodologie agile. Facilité de programmer les workflow
pros_text: Cons:Outil difficile à appréhender au début, car de multiples fonctionnalités sont présentes. La documentation n’est pas forcément très clair

title: Great ITSM product
overall_text: It is a great product, but still lots of improvements needs to be made
pros_text: Easy to use, integrations with other products, on cloud, great features
cons_text: Dashboards needs to be improved, CICD deployment integration lacks

title: JIRA Review
overall_text: Overall, my experience has been good. I use it to check on certain issues that are still pending. Even though I'm not part of the team who is handling the issues, I can still easily check on the progress/updates.
pros_text: What I like the most about JIRA is that we can easily collaborate with other people/team members who are involved in a certain project/fixing issues. We can also comment on Jira tickets for updates, suggestions, etc.
cons_text: No least liked feature, to be honest. But I think the Jira project boards can be improved by having a better display.

title: You love it or you hate it - Best tool for issue management
overall_text: We're using to keep track of all the issues of our e-commerce projects and to map all the enhancements we're about to deploy on the website.It's a great tool when you use it with your team and external partners.
pros_text: It's a great tool to manage tasks, incidents and issue management.It allows you to open task, add information, attachments, tag people and have all the historical track of the ticket management.Best feature: Google Chrome extension, which allows you to quickly open tickets and attach screenshot of the web page you are in that moment.
cons_text: It might appear complicated at the beginning; you might get lost in the tickets and in the kanban board, but it only takes some time to get used to it.

title: Indispensable en entreprise
overall_text: Pros:Dès qu’un projet informatique nécessite la gestion de version et de bug, il faut JIRA. Tout est bien organisé et suffisamment complexe pour répondre à tous les besoins.
pros_text: Cons:Quand on commence JIRA c’est compliqué de tout comprendre. Il faut insister quelques jours/semaines pour comprendre la puissance de l’outil.

title: Outil de tracking de bug et de suivi des demandes
overall_text: Pros:Pouvoir faire n'importe quelle demande (licence, signalement d'un bug, demande d'assistance), suivre le statut de la demande.
pros_text: Cons:Les premières utilisation ne sont pas toujours simples.si les rôles utilisateurs sont mal paramètrés, il se peut que les utilisateurs ne puissent pas voir leurs demandes en cours.

title: User Friendly Work Management Tool
overall_text: Pros:JIRA is very useful to use while compared to other tracking tools. It helps us to track the issues and progress assigned within the different teams. You can also filter the stories assigned to us that helps you monitor on track !
pros_text: Cons:I don't have any major dislikes about JIRA Service Management.

title: Excellent tool!
overall_text: My overall experience has been excellent! I’d definitely choose this software over any other similar.
pros_text: The simplicity of the overall software is a huge plus. I didn’t know a company would be better off until I used it. And now I can’t see myself not using it! It’s a simplistic design and very easy to use.
cons_text: There’s always an issue when adding bulleted lists! When starting a paragraph underneath it always seems to indent it. Not sure why. But definitely not a deal-breaker.

title: Service Desk, a great intake tool for Jira
overall_text: We needed a way to take in user issues and then sort them into the teams that need to handle them. Service desk provides a great interface for our current issue tracking system, so it was a no-brainer.
pros_text: We use this software as a front-facing user portal to submit bugs, hardware issues, service requests, etc. I find that it performs this task admirably.
cons_text: The system for queueing things is clunky until you figure out it's features, then it's a little slow. I would love the ability to define custom actions on the issue page to remove multiple click issue transitions, like 'transfer to x project'

title: Massive software package that can be customised to your preferences
overall_text: After initial hick ups with the system being slow I now really like it and cannot see myself using any other ticketing system.
pros_text: The huge number of features available. The Kanban board which gives you clear view of the tickets being managed by you. The tickets recently updated waiting to be looked at by the Support desk, tickets on hold and 3rd party escalation tickets.
cons_text: When putting the ticket on hold you must go through an extra step. So must put a blank comment to put the ticket on hold on the kanban board

title: Industry benchmark tools but prepare well before you begin
overall_text: This is a love and hate affair. Service Desk is extraordinary software and its capabilities broad. But it's not for the faint of heart. If we could start over we'd pause to learn, then plan, and plan very carefully. This is a project, not something you setup in your afternoon following a lunch break. And with any project, its success is measured in its planning. But learn Service Desk before planning because with the knowledge of what it's truly capable of, you'll be able to build a very powerful service desk solution. My only gripe is that it's not intuitive. We work amongst high level developers who also fumble their way around Service Desk, taking way too long to find what they need. There are workarounds such as bookmarking key screens, but without this approach you easily become lost in the deep levels of available screens and admin areas. Navigation is too complex.
pros_text: Service Desk's strengths are also its Achilles heel if you don't plan carefully. It's tremendously complex but powerful.
cons_text: Configuring Service Desk is by no means a simple feat. This is complex software that requires careful planning. I would strongly suggest you approach Service Desk this way: study the documentation first, write/draw a plan of what you need to achieve and how you need it to look (back and front) and perform. Planning is crucial to avoiding chasing your tail in the days/weeks that follow initial project build.

title: avaliação Jira
overall_text: Pros:de fácil utilização e intuitivo as informações são claras
pros_text: Cons:não tenho contras, é ok para o meu dia a dia
cons_text: Switched From:Ellevo Next

title: An extensive tool for managing IT projects
overall_text: Jira is developing great and although it gives a lot of options and its use, at a certain level, requires experience, in my opinion, it is probably the best system I have worked on.
pros_text: Great configurability. Advanced users can configure jira exactly for their own needs. The system collects and aggregates a lot of data from various sources.
cons_text: It takes a lot of time to master the tool. Configuration of accesses and views is a task for an experienced user. And with a possible configuration error, it may take some time to catch it.

title: A Great Ticketing System
overall_text: Pros:We have just begun using a Jira-based ticketing system to gain support from one of our vendors. So we are users rather than Administrators. However, our experience as users has made us strongly consider Jira for future projects and support implementations.It has a fantastic user interface with a decent amount of features. That said, our vendor did a slow-drip on features for us, and I'm not even convinced that they have enabled all of them yet. But just from what we've experienced, we love the software.
pros_text: Cons:The slow-drip of features from our vendor (such as seeing who is posting a response) initially made us think that Jira was to blame, but that clearly wasn't the case. I am still uncertain of whether certain features just aren't available or haven't been turned on for us, but I am confident that Jira is a reliable tool for ticketing management.Honestly, the bar is pretty low for ticketing software in my opinion, as I've seen a lot of poor software in this environment. Jira is definitely the best that I have seen so far, and I am hoping it will continue to improve. I look forward to us potentially using Jira to support our own users, so I can see it from an Administrative point-of-view.

title: A no brainier for non profits
overall_text: In the short time I've been using Jira Service Desk I've been impressed with the scope and capability and think that with the right amount of time invested into getting this setup properly it will do a fantastic job
pros_text: I've been trying loads of service desk solutions recently and while i'm still not 100% convinced on which one to settle with, Jira Service Desk is pretty high up on the list.Firstly, they offer a on premise version as well as (the more easy to setup) cloud solution. This is great for those that prefer to host their own solutions.Secondly, this on premise version is also free for non profits which makes Jira Service desk a much more viable solution than some of the other options available.The integration with confluence allows you to build out a deep self service portal, which in theory will reduce tickets. Again, this was easier to setup in the cloud version, but is also free for non profits.It seems to tick all the boxes for an ITIL service desk, which is great.
cons_text: It is missing some core features which other solutions provide out of the box, most noticeably asset tracking.While this can be accomplished via plugins, it would be nice if it just existed within the core application.

title: Honest review
overall_text: Overall I would recommend Jira, it can be time consuming to initially set up, once that is done it's smooth sailing.
pros_text: As a software Tester, I have found over the years that Jira is essential for tracking bugs with our developers and seeing which issues are ready for deployment. This softaware can be used really for any type of business.
cons_text: Creating Custom search filters was the hardest part, as there was not a lot of documentation at the time. I feel like there are a lot of features that are in the software that we do not utilize due to the lack of documentation.

title: Jira Service desk review
overall_text: I was a very happy user of Jira on the whole, and I am certainly missing it now that I have moved onto another product. I felt that it allowed many users to be involved in the issues raised, which kept all of the discussion in one central location, rather then firing off in email chains that it's easy to be omitted from.
pros_text: This is a very useable service desk, as it allows users to communicate freely if the issue that needs to be required impacts more people than the original poster.
cons_text: At time, Jira can be a little restrictive, but that is more to do with the way the product is set up by each organisation.

title: The best tool for service management
overall_text: Pros:Jira it's easily the best tool to manage service and tickets that you can get
pros_text: Cons:It can be a bit more complicated to use than the competitors but it's way better
cons_text: Switched From:Asana

title: Best Bug and Dev Tracking Application
overall_text: Pros:Development and bug tracking can be a very challenging job. But with Atlassian's Jira ticketing system tracking is very easy. Ticket can be assigned to a team/person and how long the ticket was assigned can be easily tracked. Individual team/person can be held accountable with this tool.
pros_text: Cons:Not sure if this is already there but based on the defined SLAs tickets that have crossed the SLA has to be notified to the assignee via email. This will be a reminder.

title: Jira continues to provide quality service.
overall_text: Pros:I've been using JIRA from Atlassian since early 2015. I have been using their other products such as Confluence and Trello, but found JIRA service management to be the best for our company. JIRA is a very well organized help desk software that allows us to manage our help desk tickets. The system is very user friendly and intuitive. The agents can easily use it to answer questions, assign the tickets and even create support cases.
pros_text: Cons:We were having trouble assigning live support, but we realized that we made a mistake while integrating it into our website, the problem was resolved in a short time and we did not have any other problems.
cons_text: Switched From:Zoho Desk

title: Excellent Product for whatever project and teams
overall_text: I have a good experience with Jira, I also have a extension for conect with visual studio code it's so interesting
pros_text: Really I like it. I use Jira every day. Jira has a good usabillity and hence userfriendly. You also can conect Jira with bitbuket and each ticket you can see the commit related with it. Jira has a excellent tracking of each spring I love this part.
cons_text: Sometime or hardly ever, the realtime of platform fail. It only this.

title: Easy to use , not hard to setup, lots of addons
overall_text: Easy and fast setup, high end user acceptance
pros_text: Very easy to use customer portal, easy to setup SLAs, many addons for almost anything. Potentially indefinitely extendable with the webhooks. Incident-, Problem- and Change Management come out of the box, just add Insight for JIRA and you get a full Configuration Management and Request Fulfilment solution
cons_text: Hard to write own addons,internal API could be documented better. For more complex portal ages you will need addons. Integration with Statuspage only for the cloud edition

title: Blue chip ITSM solution
overall_text: 5 stars - the best ITSM product I've used so far.
pros_text: I had used mostly ticketing/issues features, in scope of change mgmt. processes; also asset inventory modules.All of our tasks had been tracked in Jira in an agile manner, and I suffered greatly when switched to the much less mature solution - MS Teams Tasks Planner. It is no comparison to the Jira functionalities and ease of use.Asset inventory worked like a charm and it's versatile possibilities for integration allowed to finally create a single and accurate place of reference for all company IT and other assets (office, cars etc.).
cons_text: Since it is such a complex product cuite, administration can be cumbersome, i.e. it takes some time to get acquainted with SW possibilities in order to pinpoint and configure the desired features.

title: Jira for project management in SDLC
overall_text: it was pretty good software and follows industry standards, we hosted iton our own server.
pros_text: I like the way it integrates with many other tools to manage projects overall through it's SDLC. I have been utilizing this software for more than 8 years, and we have been very productive when using this product.
cons_text: I think the UI could be more intuitive add some new features for navigating through the pages, prepoluate the useful queries per boards designed and all.

title: Handy platform for Product developnment
overall_text: Easy, cost-effective and cross platform
pros_text: Service requests management, Ease of requirements & issues management, with confluence integration even requirements and publishing docs become super easy
cons_text: For our needs always found schedule development without using EPICs becomes difficult

title: Robust and highly customisable project management tool
overall_text: Pros:JIRA offers a host of features which helps me in prioritising workflow and keep track of the various user stories, tasks, issues etc. during each sprint. It is highly configurable and adaptable to a wide range of use cases.
pros_text: Cons:Firstly it is not very straightforward and requires considerable training to be provided for users who are new to this tool. Secondly, JIRA license cost can be expensive for organisations having budget constraints.

title: Everything at the same place
overall_text: Is a brilliant solution for effectively managing teams of all sizes. Personally, I truly value its capacity to effortlessly tailor the workflow according to the unique requirements of each team.
pros_text: - An array of available plugins for seamless synchronization- The comprehensive list of features proves invaluable for integrating teams of all sizes and facilitating project and task management.
cons_text: - The abundance of features can be overwhelming when trying to learn the entire suite. - Certain features like flags and notifications tend to overlap within certain workflows, resulting in some redundancy.

title: JIRA Service Management been helping us work more efficiently for over 6 years now.
overall_text: Pros:Ability to tie in our JIRA issue management, Confluence Knowledge Management, and Help Desk ticketing into a single environment with each tool playing nicely with the others.
pros_text: Cons:The change in how user access and licensing worked after we initially implemented the system, which has caused us some frustration over the years.(But new users wouldn't have that problem.)
cons_text: Reasons for Switching to JIRA Service Management:We wanted our Help Desk Tickets to be easily managed by our Issue Tracking system.

title: Jira is your ally for scrum management!
overall_text: Pros:The flexibility, all the things you can setup for a project to be tracked here, the board management, workflows, assignments, roles and that fits so great for Scrum teams.
pros_text: Cons:We are lacking to have a free test cases management in Jira.

title: Nice ITSM solution with ITIL Practices
overall_text: Robust and costumizable itsm solution adaptative for all organizations
pros_text: What i like most is the engagement that it have with ITIL practices
cons_text: What i like least is the learning curve, little bit harder than other ITSM solutions.

title: Excellent bug tracking
overall_text: Positive experience, I've used it in all of my development roles
pros_text: Works well with Bitbucket and enables good team development by identifying bugs with an ID and allowing comments and status tracking
cons_text: It needs to be more simple to view your tickets

title: Essential tool
overall_text: My experience is very positive.
pros_text: Jira is great tool for every team necessity. Simple to understand and easy to monitoring from the Admin side (licenses, product associations)
cons_text: Possibility to have setting many role and view on the tool

title: Ottima Esperienza
overall_text: esperienza positiva, lo usiamo in azienda da ormai 5 anni
pros_text: Prodotto di facile utilizzo, alto livello di customizzazione particolarmente apprezzata la funzionalità che permette l'apertura di ticket inviando una mail ad un indirizzo prestabilito.
cons_text: forse il fatto che è altamente personalizzabile si porta dietro anche un aspetto negativo che se non sai cosa vuoi tendi a complicare troppo lo strumento aggiungendo troppi campi custom.

title: Ottimo software per la gestione del lavoro IT
overall_text: Soddisfacente
pros_text: La possibilità di organizzare il lavoro in piccoli task, e tutta la gestione di tale flusso per collaborare con i tester
cons_text: A volte è un po' poco intuitivo, ma una volta capito dove stanno le cose fila tutto

title: Good software
overall_text: Overall a positive experience, it has helped with tracking and managing the state of user stories and bugs in the platforms I work on.
pros_text: Jira allows for me to write user stories and attach a description, acceptance criteria, epic, and requirement to it.It has been really helpful in providing visibility to all users to the state of user stories and the details associated with them.Jira also provides the ability to automatically upload items using a template which makes the ease of moving items from an Excel file to Jira very easy.
cons_text: Jira at times can be slow, but I am unsure whether this was due to the connection I was on using a virtual desktop, or if it was WIFI issues.Other than that, no other complaints about the software.

title: Jira a great way to manage
overall_text: I am able to track all of the internal changes of the company. As well the transparency of the system is great. There is not a lot of things you'll need to learn as it is really easy to use.
pros_text: I really like the ease of use with JIRA. We are able to track changes internally very easily. I can set several parameters to truly customize the experience.
cons_text: I wish there was an option for a user to change the color scheme. The UI is very bright and white and I wish there was a darker mode that was easier on the eyes.

title: Ok start, missing some key features
overall_text: We have a ticket workflow for IT, so things are being tracked now.
pros_text: Integration with other Atlassian products. Allowed us to start tracking IT issues and requests without having to bring on yet another tool.
cons_text: Would like to be able to more effectively roll out custom support portals for our users, but no native support for custom URLs makes this more difficult. It's too easy for customers to browse around and find portals for other customers.

title: JIra is a must for Software Development
overall_text: Pros:It helps us to organise and better understand the current progress.
pros_text: Cons:It should support github comments and it would be nice if could integrate github such that task could change progress based on github commits

title: Jira is efficient for IT project management
overall_text: I have used jira in my old project for day to day tasks, report the status in dailystandup. I feel its efficient to show the work done by individual
pros_text: I like the way tasks/tickets/bugs can be assigned to the individuals and task the progress. Its very handy when using open source software and the jira cards are available publicly to track the bugs/issues reported.
cons_text: Not very efficient when it comes to change/incident management

title: Customize your business processes to suit your needs
overall_text: Pros:The application allows for requests and referrals to be assigned to specific teams or individuals within the company's Operations and Support departments with ease. It can be seamlessly integrated with a variety of other applications, and its user interface is notably simple and easy to navigate. Moreover, notifications can be received, and requests can be tracked on mobile and tablet devices outside of working hours, allowing for the prioritization of urgent requests. Essentially, this application serves as a centralized hub for managing all internal job demand situations, and I am thoroughly pleased with its performance.
pros_text: Cons:Till now, I have not faced any adverse situations.

title: Très bon outil de gestion de projets
overall_text: Jira nous permet de partager une vision globale sur l’ensemble des projets ainsi que d’assurer un suivi complet. Chacun est autonome et peut ainsi se concentrer sur ses tâches.
pros_text: La gestion de projets via Jira est très bien pensée, tout le monde peut suivre les étapes du projet et avoir une vision quotidienne de l’avancement des tâches. C’est vraiment très simple de planifier et orchestrer les projets !
cons_text: Beaucoup de notifications envoyées, un rapport quotidien peut suffire pour suivre les projets sur lesquels il n’y a pas d’action à effectuer.

title: JIRA Service Management - Customer Service
overall_text: Overall, it is good software for managing and tracking issues.
pros_text: The service provided by JIRA is very impressive. The feature of JIRA including creating issues, assigning issues, and searching for issues is very helpful. It is easy for everyone to manage and configure. It has a user-friendly interface that non-technical users can understand.
cons_text: Finding the desired tickets for a particular type of issue can prove challenging unless you provide precise and specific search criteria. The pricing of JIRA is very expensive.

title: Excelente para equipos asincronos
overall_text: Pros:Me ha gustado la facilidad para trabajar con tíquets, es ágil para asignar las peticiones entre el equipo. Además como tiene estados puedes revisar si una petición ya se ha empezado a tratar. En el apartado de notas se puede dejar toda la información necesaria para consultarlo más adelante.
pros_text: Cons:A veces se queda un poco pillado pero por suerte no suele ser la normal y se trabaja bien

title: JIRA ticketing tool
overall_text: Jira is a complete solution for tracking an historic even and related events as the tickets and sub tickets are linked under one roof.
pros_text: This product has a detailed set of options which you can select from wide variety and skip which is not relevant,this is easy to use and can be easily integrated into any business.
cons_text: Its has lot of options but if you know what you want you stick to the points you need and skip rest.

title: Solid tool for IT Service Desk
overall_text: The Jira Service Desk is a good tool that integrates well with Confluence.
pros_text: Jira Service Desk integrates well with other Atlassian tools.I like the weekly sprint and backlog views.Very easy to create and track an issue.
cons_text: There is a little bit of a learning curve and it takes time to master every feature.The user interface is a little difficult to learn.

title: Jira Tool Review
overall_text: I have overall 2 year of experience, till now good experience using the tool on daily basis never find any challenge to use this product .
pros_text: Very Easy to use specially bug management and project management
cons_text: Workflow are hard to understand and maintain to everyone one .

title: On Prem Jira
overall_text: Gets the job done, but often frustrating
pros_text: Tracking tickets is pretty good.Email updates are reliable and configurable
cons_text: Poor search functionalityMost pages will not update when someone else changes something

title: Great Saviour and value for money product
overall_text: We have been using the software for a long and it helped us in many ways :1. Product development 2. Ticketing System 3. Patch Management
pros_text: 1. Ease of use2. Simple UI design ( which helps new users, to use the software easily and effectively )3. Variety of solutions 4. Collaborations with teams 5. Tracking of Progress6. Control and Permission
cons_text: Customizable with problem scenarios sometimes difficult to incorporate

title: Great to for work management and yracking
overall_text: Great tool. Every company should use it.
pros_text: Brilliant tool. Bug free. Give nice reports. Love the querying tool to extract data.
cons_text: None. I haven’t heard of any other software doing that great job as jira.

title: The right choice for issue management and project tracking
overall_text: Pros:Easy to use, friendly UI. You can set workflows on your own for each projects. User role management is great.
pros_text: Cons:It is a really complex system, so it takes time to reach a deeper understanding.

title: Easy to use, support a lot of integrations
overall_text: Pros:It support wide range of customization, we use two Jiras one for service desk and support teams, which looks great and you can track your case SLAs in a very easy way, the 2nd Jira used for tracking with a fully other interface.
pros_text: Cons:Easy to use, send notifications for everything happen in a case for me i can't find the option to turn off the notification but as i mentioned it's can be customized and our admins not support that customization

title: An important service management tool for every organisation
overall_text: Pros:- Very easy to categorise service requests- Easy to prioritise the service requests- Easy to track and manage service requests- Efficient way to raise and get resolution of the service requests- Great and customizable workflow
pros_text: Cons:This tool offers a great set of features and one can easily be overwhelmed with so many features. Though Atlassian has published great documentation, learning from the documentation to use is time-consuming. Atlassian should launch a series of bitesize videos demonstrating how to use it for specific use cases.

title: Great tie-ins to JIRA Agile and Confluence, clean UI, very easily customizable, personalization too!
overall_text: Pros:It's definitely an accessible software - I particularly appreciated that customization was fairly easy even for non technical resources. It didn't require a system admin nor engineer to make changes - non developers can easily understand the layout, ui, etc.
pros_text: Cons:the visual cues and aids are not terribly colorful or robust, the design is simple but it wouldn't hurt to go through a facelift to make it look more modern, dynamic, and interactive.

title: An awesome tool which can integrate everything for software development
overall_text: Its a very good tool for enterprises for software development management
pros_text: Its task management system is awesome and integration with code pipelines are ny favourite feature
cons_text: Availability and bugs are worst from there side.Price is also high

title: Great if you use Jira
overall_text: Pros:Jira Service desk is the help desk add on for Jira. It's great because it seamlessly integrates with Jira. If you're on Jira already it's a natural extension.
pros_text: Cons:It's not really viable as a stand alone product but as part of the Jira ecosystem it's a nice add on. Quite steep learning curve.
cons_text: Switched From:Trello

title: Jira Ticket
overall_text: It is an excellent system tickets with very good follow up process.
pros_text: It is an excellent system tickets with very good follow up process.
cons_text: Sometimes it is difficult find out the correct issue category

title: Excellent tool to manage and plan projects and tasks
overall_text: Document and analyze response times to incidents and projects, and with this data measure the quality of services provided to users.
pros_text: It allows you to follow up on assigned tickets and document the steps taken to resolve them, as well as their approvals by superiors. It is easy to use and integrate.
cons_text: They make a lot of view changes on a constant basis.

title: Flexible and customizable without complication
overall_text: We tried both JIRA Service Desk Cloud and Server but chose server so we could maintain our own data. Both products allow us the ability to track support tickets and internal projects across several departments. JIRA's basic features are good, but some of our features required we purchase add-ons. For example, we needed the ability to export reports in formats that the basic reports did not allow, needed to display specific reporter information on each issue, and the ability to CC, BCC, and set importance on an email notification. This was all possible with add-ons.
pros_text: Ease of useCustomizationDashboardsIntegrations
cons_text: Limited Email FunctionalitySome custom settings require system file changesLimited reporting

title: Integration is Everything
overall_text: I will continue to recommend Jira as the go-to platform for ticketing systems and service management. The main reason is Jira’s integration abilities. I have yet to meet a system that we cannot integrate into our jira instance.
pros_text: The interface is intuitive which is critical when using Jira across an organization. Team members with varying levels of tech-savvy are able to navigate tickets and collaborate.
cons_text: Setting up the workflow design is a little overwhelming for a noviceuser. With so many options, figuring out the right path for your needs can be a little daunting.

title: Best tool for managing project & Ticket
overall_text: Overall, Jira is best IT management and ticket tool. We can manager all the IT related work on jira. It's very simple and user friendly UI interface.
pros_text: - Easily manage & create client project and report- Assign issue & bug to dedicate user for that task.- Manage SLA for IT ticket & get email Alert when SLA bridge- Easily Tracking issue, task management, reports & workflow- Integrate with any third party software- Automate route ticket
cons_text: - It's very expensive license version- If we delete ticket then we can't recover.- Sometime very difficult to use

title: Jira meilleur outil de gestion de projet
overall_text: Je l'utilise Dans Des projets Fintech il est devenu un outil non remplaçable
pros_text: La gestion Des taches(bugs, stories...) de Jira est la meilleur
cons_text: Pas d'inconvénient pour moiImpeccable, rien a dire.

title: An amazing tool for project management
overall_text: Pros:I really like how much control you have over the phases and hierarchies that might grow inside a single project or task when it comes to team planning. That, in my opinion, is extremely beneficial and necessary for assignments that call for a high level of detail.
pros_text: Cons:The fact that JIRA offers so many options and customizations made it a little difficult. It feels extremely slow because there are so many repeating, mainly identical empty fields that must be filled out repeatedly.

title: Jira is the heartbeat of our company
overall_text: Overall, Jira has made our lives more manageable in terms of tickets/issues/projects management.
pros_text: Organises unlike any other management tools for all our needs. A very flexible tool and the ease of integrations with other apps via API is much appreciated.
cons_text: A little bit steep learning curve, but definitely doable after a bit of Jira training/course.

title: Customer Support - JIRA Service Management
overall_text: Jira - A Tool that is a combination of ticket creation and tracking, bug management, Incident Management, and customer support. All support and features are very helpful.
pros_text: Notifications and ticket tracking management are helpful for all types of users, like developers, process managers, and non-technical professionals.It can be integrated with several third-party applications.The support provided by them is impressive.
cons_text: Uploading files have limitation in size and format.It is better if we have an easy interface.

title: Great tool with a smooth process
overall_text: JSM has been a great tool that helps us to organize our tickets. Like any good tool, setup, and management is KEY in implementation, but it has served us well.
pros_text: I really enjoyed being able to jump into the tool without a lot of background, and understand the flow of tickets to our team. I also like the ease of communications with requesters, and its integration with our communications tools.
cons_text: We have a standard workflow company wide, so I do wish we were able to adjust a bit more, but overall I'm very happy.

title: Excelente ayuda en el trabajo diario, con ticket de atención y rápida gestión.
overall_text: Me gusta, soluciona todas las solicitudes necesarias del equipo de trabajo que a diario son varias.
pros_text: Es un producto facil de utilizar, la gestión es de rápida respuesta, muy amigable y de grata presentación.
cons_text: Creo que aportaría información del tiempo que le resta a la gestión solicitada para estar lista, como una flecha de tiempo, o algo por el estilo.

title: great test management tool
overall_text: Overall iits a great tool than other industry tools
pros_text: Effective Resource managementEffort trackingDashboardResource Assignment
cons_text: more visual analytics would help in easy assessmement

title: one of the ticket holders that I recommend
overall_text: My experience has been a test and rehearsal since, as mentioned, sometimes I understood certain things but others became a little difficult to understand and it is not because there is no documentation, there is a lot, but very watered down.but little by little and I have been understanding the things that I need.This has made it easier to serve customers very quickly in their incidents, which in other traditional media would take longer and take time.There is also evidence of the ticket in case the client wants to see the follow-up of her case
pros_text: What I liked is the intuitive system of being able to provide a client with a ticket of some incidence of their software, in a very easy way for the client to understand, with templates and sending emails, this makes it much easier for clients and fast alert of incoming tickets make this tool very good in its support team, also project management, assigned tasks graphically
cons_text: What I liked the least is that there is a learning curve a bit long to understand what you need from the tool since the tutorials are good but you can get lost in them with so many things that some contain instead of focusing on what you need

title: So much better than emails!
overall_text: Good! It’s a clear and helpful way to track work and keep things organized. Way better than trying to deal with support requests through email
pros_text: The front end UI for customers/users is really straight forward. The integration with active directory has been helpful for user access too
cons_text: The back end tends to be fragmented for administration. Our site admins all struggle to find settings in illogical places or you have to navigate through multiple different paths to change one thing. I also find that a lot of the back end settings are not clear to what they will effect for the front end user

title: Issue and BAU streamlining
overall_text: Pros:Easy to use for both business and development team to create common platform to request, acknowledge and record progress state at one place. Access controls in place. Workflows are customizable and effective
pros_text: Cons:JIRA raising could be made simple with templates created beforehand. Dashboard could be much simpler to use

title: The best Ticket System
overall_text: My favourite tool for really big software projects.
pros_text: Jira is mighty and comes in play when you have really big software projects.You are able to customise every workflow, and easy manage you projects.Also you can connect it to other Atlassian products and monitor your progress.
cons_text: Jira is quite expensive and not to easy to use. So you have to really dig in deep to understand the workflows

title: JIRA Service Management Review
overall_text: Pros:We mainly use JIRA Service Management as our ITSM, service desk, ticketing system in our company. This platform has a lot to offer and so many features that will help your IT Team on keeping track of IT related concern, incident management, inventory management, tracking of ticket and report/analytics
pros_text: Cons:Didn't have any issue encountered with JIRA Service Management platform.

title: La gestion de projet agile simplifiée avec JIRA Service Management
overall_text: Pros:JIRA Service Management est un outil salvateur pour les projets agiles, offrant un guichet unique pour tous les besoins de gestion de projet et informatique.
pros_text: Cons:L'un des inconvénients de JIRA Service Management est que les nouvelles modifications apportées aux pages HTML peuvent prendre un peu plus de temps à se charger lorsqu'elles sont transférées en production.
cons_text: Switched From:Adobe Acrobat Sign,DocusignandJotform

title: Very user-unfriendly
overall_text: Pros:It's a powerful tool, if you know how to use it.
pros_text: Cons:The UX is stuck in the 90s. Impossible to reach a lot of features without receiving very in-depth onboarding. For instance, setting up your dashboard to see issues you reported/ are watching is a task that should be easy and intuitive - but no, it's anything but. I really don't recommend this if you have any other options.

title: High Level ITSM Service Desk
overall_text: We required moving towards on-prem solutions and Jira Service Desk Server Edition allowed us to use first-rate features while maintaining our data.
pros_text: Out of the box, Jira Service Desk allows a team to start up a working service desk with a few clicks. Some of its strongest features is building out a front-facing portal for end-users, linking to the knowledge base (with Confluence).Since it's part of the larger Atlassian ecosystem, there are a lot of tools and features that can be used to provide greater customizations.
cons_text: The Jira Service Desk, while customizable has a high learning curve and will take a while for administrators and agents to be able to change workflows.The agent side can do with a UI facelift.

title: Not For Companies that Care about Support
overall_text: If you are a company that cares about treating your customers well - this is not the product for you.A litmus test that we missed - Jira does not care about customer support, so how could you expect them to truly understand the problems of companies that use it.
pros_text: Cool - you feel cool when you use it, until you realize it doesn't do what you want.JQL is good
cons_text: Not able to merge ticketsIntegrations to other services lackingNot customer first builtNot for help desks

title: Avaliação Jira
overall_text: Pros:A patricidade de gestão de tasks. A eficácia do monitoramento das atividades da equipe e a organização dos itens.
pros_text: Cons:O recurso de clonar uma task pode ser melhorado. Ao clonar uma task, precisamos atualizar a página e encontrar onde ela foi parar. Se ela já aparecesse na tela (sem precisar ficar buscando por ela) seria o ideal.

title: Software perfetto per la gestione aziendale di sviluppo software
overall_text: Ottima divisione dei task tra vari membri di un gruppo di lavoro
pros_text: La possibilità di organizzare e dividere ogni progetto in task e subtask, la prioritizzazione e la possibilità di fare il log delle attività
cons_text: Nessun inconveniente. Jira è un tool estremamente utile e facile da usare. Molto probabilmente l'unicoaspetto negativo potrebbe essere il costo di licenza

title: JIRA for Project Management
overall_text: Overall it’s a very important tool in our project management.
pros_text: The issue assignment, collaboration and prioritisation are the best features of this software. Recurring issues feature also tops the list of best features. Best tool ever.
cons_text: Dashboard needs more timely updates as sometimes it doesn’t reflect the right amount of issues a team member is working on.

title: Great Project and IT ticket management tool
overall_text: Overall, JIRA is a simple to use and configure. It's easily manage all the client project, Task and bug reports in jira management tool. It's easily manager all the IT related assets and complain ticket. We can set the SLA alert and configure the notification from email.
pros_text: - Easy to use for users- User friendly interface & GUI- Easily manager project and task- Easy to assign task for respective user andtracking bug, issue and IT ticket- Good for IT & service desk ticket tool
cons_text: - Sometime performance is slow- I don’t find any major issue with Jira.

title: Track tasks efficiently with JIRA
overall_text: With JIRA you can track anything hassle-free. For a product manager who manages multiple sprints and creates hundreds of task on a monthly basis, JIRA is very useful.
pros_text: a. Set custom priority, labels, and selected the sprint in which the story will be picked upb. Drag and drop feature helps in prioritizing storiesc. You can easily customize the duration of a sprintd. Sprint is divided into three major sections (To Do, In Progress, Done) for getting overview
cons_text: a. For someone who has not used this tool might find it difficult to understandb. Set up is very tedious

title: Great task management
overall_text: Pros:Great flow management with the status of the taks, division by Epics very useful and categories like bug, task, and so on.
pros_text: Cons:At the beginning it's a bit difficult to learn how it works
cons_text: Alternatives Considered:Trello

title: Crutial tool to use with it tasks
overall_text: It, product design, marketing - great to combine multitasks with all other departments
pros_text: Convenient and user friendly, quick to place the task and communicate on different task with the whole team right in the ticket
cons_text: Could have more features like diagrams for task fulfillment funnels. More visual solutions. Plus would be great to have own daily task board

title: Significant improvement over a simple Jira board but complex to set it up
overall_text: I love the automation part and this makes it much more productive compared to a regular Jira board. So I can only recommend it.
pros_text: We are mainly using it for customer support and tracking user issues in it. It is a huge improvement over a Jira board because it offers various automations. We can set it up to ping certain user groups on ticket creation or simply do periodic reminders for the assigned people. It is really hard to summarise what can be automated because there are a lot of options.
cons_text: I think it is power comes from the various custom automations. But this is its drawback too because it can get really complicated to set up what you actually want to achieve. And a second thing I want to mention is that it is probably not cheap because in the company we need to have a good reason for adding an extra license.

title: Awesome ITSM tool
overall_text: We use it for getting tickets from our customers and internal employee ranging from bugs, vacation request, improvement, order coffe and legal advice! Very flexible.We use also it attached to a strong asset management add-on
pros_text: Easy out of the box customer portalemail integrationextreme powerful workflowlots of integration availableGreat integration with Confluence!Extremely expandable with tons of add-on
cons_text: no native PBX integration but you can build one

title: Must have IT Project Management suite
overall_text: Pros:All functionalities you need for your software development projects, hundreds of add-ons
pros_text: Cons:Software licensing is not so easy to manage

title: Muy bueno
overall_text: Pros:me gusto mucho que proporciona metricas claras a lo que se requiere, su hoja de ruta avanzada, aparte es muy intuitivo.
pros_text: Cons:si por X o Y razon se llega a eliminar por herror algun ticket este no se puede recuperar, espero que en una actualizacion futura puedan modificar este inconveniente.

title: No 1 ITSM tool
overall_text: It has drastically reduced time of incident and fixing that issue in a streamlined way and faster. It also helped us to record all the activity during the fix thus helping us to fix the same issue in future more quickly,
pros_text: I like the alerts and current status of the ticket. I really like the ticket management activity on cloud. Workflow is easy to learn and understand. It helped use to reach client expectation.Good categorisation of issues.
cons_text: Customer support sometimes are taking longer time to respond to the issues.

title: Helped simplify the customer support experience and connect the support team with developers
overall_text: Pros:How it interacts with the rest of atlassian's offerings means that entire companies can be integrated on the same platform. From a customer support point of view it is very easy to track tickets, properly escalate, and properly resolve
pros_text: Cons:There can be some struggles in finding the exact workflows that work correctly. Additionally, there have been some issues with notifications sending to customers outside of the organization. If these customers miss the notifications it can hinder the communication they are receiving if they do not check their portal.

title: Functional, easy to use, and effective for our ITSM processes
overall_text: Pros:As an existing Atlassian customer we were in the market for a new tool to manage our incidents, problems, requests, and changes. Jira Service Desk was simple to configure and deploy to our IT Service Desk.
pros_text: Cons:In an effort to reduce the workload on my Service Desk technicians I want to make ticket creation simple as possible. Jira Service Desk can require a lot of clicks during ticket creation.

title: Great Service Desk option for low budget
overall_text: Overall Jira Service Desk has been a fantastic tool to help organise our company internally with IT tasks and help requests, as well as capturing client help requests and issues to build up our knowledge base and provide it as a go to source of information for help on our software outside the phone.
pros_text: Budget option, links in with existing Jira productsEase of use, setting up basic web accessible help desk and knowledge base
cons_text: Unable to separate internal and external help desks to different URL's so they can be accessed separately, this could change with the service desk refresh coming feb 2019

title: Service desk that works well with other JIRA tools
overall_text: Pros:Since we use JIRA Software, it was just a matter of time until we decided to implement JIRA Service Desk. So far it's worked fairly well and gives us a central location to manage our helpdesk requests from our employees. Being a JIRA product, you know it's powerful, but you also know that it takes a bit of work to get it up and running. You also know it's not going to look too sexy ;) It does it's job and gives us a good place to manage our tickets and gives our users the option to leave feedback, which helps us do our job even better.
pros_text: Cons:It's JIRA, it's not the most aesthetically pleasing tool, but it does what it advertises and help us more easily manage our tickets.

title: Great product - Not for everyone
overall_text: It's been received well. Other departments within the company are adopting it.
pros_text: I like the ability to customize all my views and workflows. I'm able to setup SLAs and track response time and resolution time. It holds us accountable. Our employees like the portal to submit tickets. By submitting tickets under specific categories, it routes them to the right person in the IT department.
cons_text: It takes time to get the service desk up and running and is a bit confusing. You may meet resistant at first but users will quickly see the value.

title: Jira is the best issue tracking software out out there!
overall_text: Pros:Easy to use, easy to configure, easy to train internal team members on how to use and set up workflow; great visualizations and ability to track and trend issues is unparalleled
pros_text: Cons:There is not much that I dislike about the software. I guess what could be improved is potential integration with IoT products or IFTTT

title: Jira Service Management
overall_text: Pros:Good tool for managing task progress in a project
pros_text: Cons:There's a learning curve associated with using Jira service management.

title: Amazing tool for sorting your company problems
overall_text: Software problems reporting for clients, in-house sorted problem manager
pros_text: I like that it is so customizable - you can create different directories, workflows how to solve a task, say how important tasks are.
cons_text: When there are many teams and the service desk ticket count is high then the resource needed to load the page jumps up - but its just few more seconds.

title: Jira for IT Teams
overall_text: Overall, this is a great tool for service teams. Managers will enjoy the dashboard view of metrics and the customizable queues.
pros_text: The Service Management tool for Atlassian is a great option for medium to large teams. One of my favorite things about this is the customizable options for all areas of the tool. It can be expanded to include all kinds of reportable metrics for teams of any size. There are tons of integrations as well, making this a great tool for those who want flexibility.
cons_text: Jira tends to launch updates or force updates for the interface right when we get used to the last set of changes. It is also somewhat slow, or slower than I think it should be, even with solid internet connectivity.

title: I really like jira, because it is a practical application and very easy to use.
overall_text: Greatly optimized the organization of the projects
pros_text: Work management becomes clear, facilitated, and interaction simplified.
cons_text: At the moment I have no criticism to describe about the app

title: JIRA - Amazing tool for Project management
overall_text: Great tool, ease of use and the project management experience is amazing.
pros_text: JIRA is super easy to use, even a beginner can adapt more quickly and it is great tool for project task management and provides good flexibility.
cons_text: Not much to think at this point, really a great tool to be recommended for large scale of users.

title: Use to raise service tickets to IT department
overall_text: Our company users jira service management software to handle the support services like IT.
pros_text: Whenever we face a problem, we raise a request using jira service management to the IT department. It has customizable service request workflow where users can track their status and history. This really save the time and increase the task quality by showing the visibility of a request to the user.
cons_text: The only thing I see is the price. Software is not affordable for startups.

title: Contract Management Made Easy
overall_text: The overall experience with JIRA Service Management is super great and it made our contract management way more efficient.
pros_text: I like most about the software, that it does fast the job it needs to do (contract management in my case) within an easy-to-use and visually appealing user-interface.
cons_text: At the beginning you need to spend some time to explore all the features and workflows, so that you really leverage the full power of the software and use all its features as good as possible.

title: Great customer support tracking
overall_text: Pros:Jira offers great ticketing tracking offering users great support
pros_text: Cons:There are some features mising like the ability to add an object to the ticket
cons_text: Switched From:TOPdesk

title: JIRA Service Management outils gestion de IT management
overall_text: Pros:JIRA Service Management outils gestion de IT managementpour les entreprises
pros_text: Cons:Pas d'inconvénients dans l'utilisation de JIRA Service Management
cons_text: Switched From:Dashboard Hub for Jira

title: Not Great for Helpdesk Purposes
overall_text: I looked forward to setting up JIRA Service Desk as a welcome challenge to create a helpdesk ticketing system from scratch. They have some presets for you to choose from, but only a couple of them were applicable to the way we do business out of the box. I enjoyed that I was able to create workflows to make automation easy/possible. However, I was constantly running into configuration confusion when trying to piece together the parts that make everything work properly; the admin console was often hard to navigate. Licensing was also an issue for us. We were using the cheapest version of the software because there were only two administrators using the software, and the price spike didn't warrant more licensing. However, I wanted to be able to assign users to specific roles within a ticket so they would be able to receive status emails, but they were unable to watch or approve tickets because the console did not recognize them as properly licensed users. To me, licensed users should not need to include managers who may need to watch or approve certain tickets, but Atlassian's structure is not setup this way.
pros_text: I liked that I was able to build out workflows in order to make managing tickets more automated.
cons_text: It was often hard to configure, and licensing makes approval processes very restrictive.

title: Best solution in market for any Digital/IT company
overall_text: Pros:1) Extremely well thought of ticket management via Epic links,project buckets etc2) Issue collector functionality that can be directly embedded to websites and web portals3) Tickets can be linked with other Atlassian products like a Conflience page or bit bucket4) Easy to create and manage sprints
pros_text: Cons:1) Third party integrations are not available/limited like that with google drive etc.2) There are few free solutions that offer something similar. Not as rohbust as JIRA but might still do the job for few.

title: Easy to use, well integrated with other Atlassian products
overall_text: I have deployed Jira Service Desk at a big online university in Spain. They had already other Atlassian products such as Jira and Confluence.The alternative was Freshdesk, but Jira Service Desk had a way better integration with Jira, the tool they are using for all the software development, issue tracking and project management. It is also very clear in the usage model and configuration.The product has evolved nicely from V2 to V3.
pros_text: Easy to usePowerful and extensiblePricing model based on agents, it is not cheap but you can have unlimited customers for free
cons_text: Not so mature in terms of reporting, automatic queue management, etc.

title: Very flexible. Integrates great with other tools.
